official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of Defense to establish within
		  the Department of Defense centers of excellence in the prevention, diagnosis,
		  mitigation, treatment, and rehabilitation of health conditions relating to
		  exposure to open burn pits.

) introduced the following

text.#text:
In selecting sites for
			 the centers of excellence under

are equipped with
			 the specialized equipment needed to study, diagnose, and treat health
			 conditions relating to exposure to open burn pits and other environmental
			 exposures;

have collaborated
			 with a geosciences department that has a medical geology division;

have developed
			 animal models and in vitro models of dust immunology and lung injury from Iraq
			 and Afghanistan; and

have expertise in
			 allergy and immunology, pulmonary diseases, and industrial and management
			 engineering.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that the centers collaborate to the maximum extent
			 practicable with the

, institutions of higher
			 education, and other appropriate public and private entities (including
			 international entities) to carry out the responsibilities specified in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Helping Veterans Exposed to Toxic Chemicals Act/s:2/ss:d

text.#text: The

The
			 center shall have responsibilities as follows:

To implement the comprehensive plan and
			 strategy for the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of best practices for the treatment of
			 health conditions relating to exposure to open burn pits and other
			 environmental exposures.

text.#text:
To provide for the development, testing,
			 and dissemination within the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in determining the personnel required to provide quality
			 health care for members of the Armed Forces with health conditions relating to
			 exposure to open burn pits and other environmental exposures.

text.#text:
To provide guidance for the health system
			 of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in the
			 treatment of health conditions relating to exposure to open burn pits and other
			 environmental exposures.

text.#text:
To establish, implement, and oversee a
			 comprehensive program to train health professionals of the

To facilitate
			 advancements in the study of the short-term and long-term effects of exposure
			 to open burn pits and other environmental exposures.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
best practices for training health
			 professionals with respect to health conditions relating to exposure to open
			 burn pits and other environmental exposures.

text.#text:
To disseminate within the military medical
			 treatment facilities of the

To conduct basic science and translational
			 research on health conditions relating to exposure to open burn pits and other
			 environmental exposures for the purposes of understanding the etiology of such
			 conditions and developing preventive interventions and new treatments.

To provide medical treatment to all
			 veterans identified as part of the burn pits registry established under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 201 of the Dignified Burial and Other Veterans' Benefits Improvement Act of
			 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dignified Burial and Other Veterans' Benefits Improvement Act of 2012/s:201

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the center shall have access to and
			 make use of the data accumulated by the burn pits registry established under

text.#text: In this section:

quote.#tail:
means
			 an area of land located in Afghanistan or Iraq that—

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to be used for disposing solid waste by burning in the
			 outdoor air; and

text.#text:
is designated by
			 the

does not contain a

quote.#tail:
means exposure to environmental
			 hazards, including burn pits, dust or sand, hazardous materials, and waste at
			 any site in Afghanistan or Iraq that emits smoke containing pollutants present
			 in the environment or smoke from fires or explosions.
